your-grove.definition: Your personal blog and website on Grove — your corner of the internet, at {you}.grove.place.
your-grove.usageExample:
"Welcome to my grove."
"Come visit Autumn's grove."

your-garden.definition: Your blog's main page — where all your posts are listed for visitors to browse.
your-garden.usageExample:
"Browse my garden."
"New blooms in the garden."

blooms.definition: Your blog posts — the things you write and publish on your Grove site.
blooms.usageExample:
"Read my latest bloom."
"I wrote a new bloom this morning."
"Their garden has beautiful blooms."

lattice.definition: The shared framework that powers every Grove site — UI components, design tools, and platform utilities.

arbor.definition: Your blog's admin dashboard — where you write posts, manage pages, upload images, and configure settings.

plant.definition: Grove's signup and setup flow — takes you from first visit to publishing your first post.

loam.definition: Checks usernames and domains for reserved words, impersonation, and harmful content before you can claim them.

amber.definition: Your file storage manager — see what's using space, download your uploads, and clean up what you don't need.

foliage.definition: Your blog's visual theme — colors, fonts, and seasonal styles that control how your site looks.

curios.definition: Fun extras for your blog — guestbooks, hit counters, link gardens, custom cursors, and other old-web touches that make your space feel lived in.

burrow.definition: A way to give trusted people access to another Grove site without making them create a separate account.

rings.definition: Private analytics for your blog — who's reading, what resonates, how your site grows over time. Only you can see them.

clearing.definition: Grove's public status page — check here to see if services are running normally or if something's down.

porch.definition: Where you go to get help or ask a question — Grove's support system.

wisp.definition: A writing assistant that checks grammar, tone, and readability — without generating or rewriting your content.

trails.definition: Public roadmaps you can share — milestones, phases, and progress on whatever you're building.

trace.definition: A small feedback widget that lets visitors say whether something was helpful, with room for a short note.

centennial.definition: After 12 months of paid membership, your grove.place URL stays online for 100 years — even if you stop paying.

vineyard.definition: Grove's component showcase — a live gallery of every UI piece, nature asset, and design tool available in the platform.

flow.definition: Grove's blog editor — a distraction-free Markdown writing space inside your admin dashboard.

terrarium.definition: A drag-and-drop canvas where you arrange nature components into scenes, then use them as decorations on your blog.

weave.definition: A node-graph editor inside Terrarium for creating animations and diagrams by connecting components together.

reverie.definition: An AI layer that translates your intent ("make it cozy", "add something that glows") into actual component arrangements for your blog.

scribe.definition: Voice-to-text for the blog editor — hold a button, speak, and your words appear as text at the cursor.

reeds.definition: Blog comments — supports private replies to the author and public threaded conversations.

thorn.definition: Automated content moderation that scans for harmful material — without storing or training on your content.

canopy.definition: Grove's opt-in directory — browse who's growing here, discover other wanderers, and find your people.

meadow.definition: A social feed where you follow other Grove blogs and see their posts in chronological order — no algorithms.

forests.definition: Themed community directories where similar blogs are grouped together — like GeoCities neighborhoods, but with Grove's nature-first naming.

wander.definition: An immersive 3D experience where you walk through a virtual forest and discover other people's Grove sites.

grafts.definition: Per-blog feature flags that the grove keeper enables for specific sites — like turning on new capabilities or beta features.

waystone.definition: Contextual help markers throughout Grove — tap one to see what a term or feature means without leaving the page.

gossamer.definition: An open-source visual effects library — ASCII patterns, ambient textures, and atmospheric backgrounds for websites.

ivy.definition: A privacy-focused email client for your @grove.place address — encrypted and minimal.

verge.definition: Serverless remote coding infrastructure — ephemeral compute environments that spin up, do the work, and disappear.

forage.definition: An AI-powered domain search tool — describe your project and get a curated list of available domain names.

nook.definition: A private video sharing space for small friend groups — faces auto-blurred, content processed locally before sharing.

shutter.definition: A web content distillation service — give it a URL and a question, get clean focused content back instead of raw HTML noise.

outpost.definition: An on-demand Minecraft server for friends — spins up when someone wants to play, shuts down when idle to save costs.

aria.definition: A music discovery tool — give it a song you love, and it builds a playlist of tracks with similar sonic DNA, with explanations for each pick.

etch.definition: Your personal link library — save URLs, highlight text, tag what matters, and find it all later.

trove.definition: A library book discovery tool — point your camera at a shelf and see which books match your taste.

heartwood.definition: Grove's login and identity system — one account that works across every Grove property.

pantry.definition: Grove's shop — subscriptions, merchandise, credits, and gift cards.

passage.definition: The subdomain router that sends visitors to the right Grove site when they type {you}.grove.place.

petal.definition: Image safety scanning — checks every uploaded photo and media file for harmful content before it appears on your site.

warden.definition: The API gateway that handles outbound requests to third-party services, keeping API keys secure and never exposed.

press.definition: An image processing tool — converts photos to web format, generates alt text with AI, deduplicates, and uploads to storage.

vista.definition: Infrastructure monitoring — tracks health, latency, errors, and costs across all Grove services with real-time dashboards.

patina.definition: Automated nightly backups of every Grove database, with weekly archives and 12 weeks of history.

mycelium.definition: Grove's MCP server — lets AI assistants read your posts, manage files, and interact with Grove services through a single interface.

lumen.definition: The AI gateway that routes all AI requests to the right model, with rate limiting, data scrubbing, and usage logging.

zephyr.definition: The email delivery service that sends all Grove emails — onboarding, notifications, support replies — with retries and templates.

shade.definition: Grove's defense against AI scrapers and data harvesters — robots.txt, meta tags, rate limiting, and legal protections working together.

wanderer.definition: Anyone visiting Grove, whether they have an account or not — the default word for "visitor" or "user" here.

rooted.definition: Someone who's signed up, paid, and created their own Grove blog — what other platforms would call a "subscriber."

pathfinder.tagline: Trusted guides appointed by the Wayfinder.
pathfinder.definition: A trusted community volunteer who helps other Grove members — appointed by the Wayfinder, similar to a moderator.
pathfinder.usageExample: "Ask a Pathfinder. They'll show you the way."

wayfinder.definition: Autumn — the person who built and runs Grove. There is one Wayfinder.
wayfinder.usageExample: "The Wayfinder welcomes you to the grove."

seedling.definition: Grove's entry-level plan ($8/month) — 50 posts, 1 GB storage, and curated themes to get started.

sapling.definition: Grove's mid-tier plan ($12/month) — more storage, more themes, email forwarding, and Centennial eligibility.

oak.definition: Grove's pro plan ($25/month) — unlimited posts, theme customizer, custom domain, and analytics.

evergreen.definition: Grove's top-tier plan ($35/month) — everything Grove offers, including custom fonts, dedicated support, and a domain included.

workshop.definition: A behind-the-scenes directory of all the internal services that power Grove — for curious visitors who want to see how it works.

fireside.definition: A conversational writing mode — Wisp asks you questions, you answer naturally, and your words get organized into a draft.

vines.definition: Sidebar widgets alongside your blog posts — related links, callouts, annotations, and other contextual content in the margins.
